title: The Devil In Your Eyes
body:
Could Thor’s little brother be more than just mischief?

The Devil In Your Eyes

Dark tears of mascara were running down your face as you rushed into your building. You tried your best to keep the sobs down, but even the smallest whimper echoed on the empty corridor.Once on the…

Read more…

blog.name: fantasycrushes
blog.title: One shots and fanfictions of your favorite crushes

body:
Your Cap - Chris Evans Oneshot

There you were, lying on your couch reading smutty Captain America fanfiction on your phone. It was late, or early depending on how you looked at it. It had just gone 3 and you were trying to stay up to greet your man when he came home.

His flight had been delayed due to weather and he insisted on taking a cab as he didn’t really know when he’d finally arrive. Your eyes were getting heavy so you decided to rest your eyes, for just a bit. You placed your phone on your stomach and clasped your hands together on top of it.

Not long after you were awoken by a loud thunder clap. Slightly disoriented you look around and see your boyfriend, Chris perched on the other end of the sectional couch. He looks up through the phone he is scrolling through and you realize it’s yours.

“So,” he begins, “when I ask you what you’re doin’ on your phone and you say ‘just playing’ you’re really reading this.”

A blush creeps across your face and you fight the urge to bury yourself in the blankets and all you can manage is a small nod. You’d  been caught. He lets out a chuckle and sets your phone on the coffee table. Chris walks over to where you are laying and lifts your feet to sit. He places your legs back down then grabs your forearm to sit you up. He places a hand on your hip while the other tangles in your hair as he pulls you in for a kiss.

“I hope the real thing is better.” He says when he pulls back.

Breathless you reply, “God, yes,” and resume kissing *your* Captain America.

title: Running From My Shadow
body:
Loki has escaped the Asgard prison, again.

Soft Praise To a Hard Lie

It had become one of his favorite hobbies, if not the only one. Sneaking out of prison every other day was something that filled Loki with joy, whether it was to steal something or play pranks on Thor…

and I mean we already know that Spidey lives
title: Thought
body:
So, Avengers: Infinity War deaths are supposed to be permanent, right?  What if that doesn’t mean that whoever dies in Infinity War is permanently dead, but that whoever’s STILL dead by the end of part II is permanently dead.

So technically, everyone who “died” in Part I has potential to come back in Part II.

I have hope.

blog.name: pele-of-the-mcu
blog.title: Art blog/ random posts or reposts
blog.description:
"That your wrong... and you think your right..that makes you dangerous!"
-Peter Parker, CACW, 2016

body:
???

I don’t get it. People are always going on about Peter and Tony having a father son relationship…. which I love. Iron dad and Spiderson for life, but…

What happened to Harley Keener?

I feel like everyone’s forgotten that little science savvy kid who warmed Tony’s arc reactor-heart in Iron Man 3? I know Peter and Tony have a better relationship, but I’ve got news.

Harley Keener is coming back in Avengers 4

The little guy is now 16, but it was confirmed by IMDb that he’s coming back.

Do give him some love y'all! Reblog or like if you like the idea of Harley returning to the MCU

blog.name: culturebay
blog.title: sebastian stan owns me
blog.description: i mainly write teen!readers | REQUESTS CLOSED | masterlist | taglist

summary: Hello!! I hope you’re doing well :) I was wondering if you could possibly write an Avengers x teen!reader where Y/N is like...
question: Hello!! I hope you’re doing well :) I was wondering if you could possibly write an Avengers x teen!reader where Y/N is like deathly afraid of thunderstorms because of something that happened when she was little and one night there happens to be a huge one and it leads to the whole team comforting her and making her feel safe? Thank you so much In advance! Ps I love your writing it’s amazing 😍
answer:
Another grumble hits feeling the vibrations in your chest. It’s louder than the last one meaning that the storm is getting closer. You hide under your bed, holding onto your pet bunny, Thumper, for dear life. Thumper isn’t phased by the loud thunder or the bright flashing lights. You had contemplated on bothering the team about it but nobody knows about your past and your fear of storms. When you were six you lost your family to a storm, much like this one. You try not to think about it but as every grumble of thunder becomes louder and the lightning becomes brighter, it’s hard to push away the memories.

You remember the crack of the lightning when it hit your home, but you had been so used to storms that season that you didn’t think anything of it. You woke up to fire all around you, the smoke filling up your lungs, making it impossible to breathe or see. The flames were huge and hot, you thought for sure you were going to burn alive. Living on a boat with your dad, mum and sister, you thought for sure that one of them would have woken you up, unless- no don’t even think about that. Your family dog was the one who came in and dragged you to safety. The fire rescue team were too late. Your home had been destroyed, leaving you standing on the jetty alone with your pjs and dog.

A fireman walked up to you and wrapped you in a blanket, guiding you over to the ambulance to get checked out. “Are they waiting for me?” You fragile voice speaks up. The fireman looks to the paramedics, the look of sympathy and sadness. You catch their glance, “Oh…” You look back out to your now destroyed home. You couldn’t understand how this could have happened. It’s been the biggest storm of the year, yet somehow all that rain couldn’t put the fire out. How was it that your home was the only home that was hit? Why were you the only one who made it out? So many questions that nobody could ever answer.

“Lady (Y/n)! Are you in there?” Thor calls out, breaking you out of your trance. You wipe away the tears that managed to roll down your cheeks.

You crawl out from under your bed and run to the door. “Thor Thor!”

“My apologies. It slipped my mind that you have a fear of storms. Unfortunately, there is nothing I can do about the storm but the Avengers and myself can take your mind off it,” Thor explains as he guides you into the living area where everyone is seated. You place yourself between Nat and Clint where they both immediately comfort you; Nat wiping your tears away and making you blow your nose, while Clint rubs your back. Although, you’re a teenager and is capable of taking care of yourself, you let yourself be a child around Clint and Nat as they fill in the roles of your guardians.

“Alright, now that everyone is here, we can begin. Is everyone familiar with the game Jibber Jabber?” Everyone nods their heads and says yes. Jibber Jabber is by far one of your favourite games to play with the family. Tony makes you start off, handing you your mouth piece and a card. Nat and Clint give you some space to read the card. Once you’ve read it you put your mouth piece in and try to read it out.

“Higonks hoohk herecty on heeholes horches,” you struggle to pronounce your sentences out to the group, everyone is immediately filled with laughter, unable to understand a single thing you said. “HIGONS,” you pause waiting for them to catch on.

“Pigeons?” Bucky questions. Your face lights up as you point and nod at him. You slowly repeat your whole sentence until the team guesses all the words right.

“Wait, wait. Pigeons poop perfectly on people’s porches?” Clint asks and you nod at him and smile, taking out your mouth piece and wrapping it in some paper towel. By now the storm has become background noises as you and the team fill the air with laughter. “Oh my god, that’s perfect!” he laughs and wraps you up in a hug. The power goes out but it’s the least of your worries, you’ve got Clint and Nat right by your side and the rest of the team around you too. The others aren’t too worried, they pull out flashlights and phones to carry on with the game.

Their warmth is nothing compared to the storm raging outside. 

Permanent Tags: @barnes-mendes

reblog.comment:

“Lady (Y/n)! Are you in there?” Thor calls out, breaking you out of your trance. You wipe away the tears that managed to roll down your cheeks.

You crawl out from under your bed and run to the door. “Thor Thor!”

“My apologies. It slipped my mind that you have a fear of storms. Unfortunately, there is nothing I can do about the storm but the Avengers and myself can take your mind off it,” Thor explains as he guides you into the living area where everyone is seated. You place yourself between Nat and Clint where they both immediately comfort you; Nat wiping your tears away and making you blow your nose, while Clint rubs your back. Although, you’re a teenager and is capable of taking care of yourself, you let yourself be a child around Clint and Nat as they fill in the roles of your guardians.

“Alright, now that everyone is here, we can begin. Is everyone familiar with the game Jibber Jabber?” Everyone nods their heads and says yes. Jibber Jabber is by far one of your favourite games to play with the family. Tony makes you start off, handing you your mouth piece and a card. Nat and Clint give you some space to read the card. Once you’ve read it you put your mouth piece in and try to read it out.

“Higonks hoohk herecty on heeholes horches,” you struggle to pronounce your sentences out to the group, everyone is immediately filled with laughter, unable to understand a single thing you said. “HIGONS,” you pause waiting for them to catch on.

“Pigeons?” Bucky questions. Your face lights up as you point and nod at him. You slowly repeat your whole sentence until the team guesses all the words right.

“Wait, wait. Pigeons poop perfectly on people’s porches?” Clint asks and you nod at him and smile, taking out your mouth piece and wrapping it in some paper towel. By now the storm has become background noises as you and the team fill the air with laughter. “Oh my god, that’s perfect!” he laughs and wraps you up in a hug. The power goes out but it’s the least of your worries, you’ve got Clint and Nat right by your side and the rest of the team around you too. The others aren’t too worried, they pull out flashlights and phones to carry on with the game.

Their warmth is nothing compared to the storm raging outside. 

Permanent Tags: @barnes-mendes

trail.content_raw:
Another grumble hits feeling the vibrations in your chest. It’s louder than the last one meaning that the storm is getting closer. You hide under your bed, holding onto your pet bunny, Thumper, for dear life. Thumper isn’t phased by the loud thunder or the bright flashing lights. You had contemplated on bothering the team about it but nobody knows about your past and your fear of storms. When you were six you lost your family to a storm, much like this one. You try not to think about it but as every grumble of thunder becomes louder and the lightning becomes brighter, it’s hard to push away the memories.

You remember the crack of the lightning when it hit your home, but you had been so used to storms that season that you didn’t think anything of it. You woke up to fire all around you, the smoke filling up your lungs, making it impossible to breathe or see. The flames were huge and hot, you thought for sure you were going to burn alive. Living on a boat with your dad, mum and sister, you thought for sure that one of them would have woken you up, unless- no don’t even think about that. Your family dog was the one who came in and dragged you to safety. The fire rescue team were too late. Your home had been destroyed, leaving you standing on the jetty alone with your pjs and dog.

A fireman walked up to you and wrapped you in a blanket, guiding you over to the ambulance to get checked out. “Are they waiting for me?” You fragile voice speaks up. The fireman looks to the paramedics, the look of sympathy and sadness. You catch their glance, “Oh…” You look back out to your now destroyed home. You couldn’t understand how this could have happened. It’s been the biggest storm of the year, yet somehow all that rain couldn’t put the fire out. How was it that your home was the only home that was hit? Why were you the only one who made it out? So many questions that nobody could ever answer.

“Lady (Y/n)! Are you in there?” Thor calls out, breaking you out of your trance. You wipe away the tears that managed to roll down your cheeks.

You crawl out from under your bed and run to the door. “Thor Thor!”

“My apologies. It slipped my mind that you have a fear of storms. Unfortunately, there is nothing I can do about the storm but the Avengers and myself can take your mind off it,” Thor explains as he guides you into the living area where everyone is seated. You place yourself between Nat and Clint where they both immediately comfort you; Nat wiping your tears away and making you blow your nose, while Clint rubs your back. Although, you’re a teenager and is capable of taking care of yourself, you let yourself be a child around Clint and Nat as they fill in the roles of your guardians.

“Alright, now that everyone is here, we can begin. Is everyone familiar with the game Jibber Jabber?” Everyone nods their heads and says yes. Jibber Jabber is by far one of your favourite games to play with the family. Tony makes you start off, handing you your mouth piece and a card. Nat and Clint give you some space to read the card. Once you’ve read it you put your mouth piece in and try to read it out.

“Higonks hoohk herecty on heeholes horches,” you struggle to pronounce your sentences out to the group, everyone is immediately filled with laughter, unable to understand a single thing you said. “HIGONS,” you pause waiting for them to catch on.

“Pigeons?” Bucky questions. Your face lights up as you point and nod at him. You slowly repeat your whole sentence until the team guesses all the words right.

“Wait, wait. Pigeons poop perfectly on people’s porches?” Clint asks and you nod at him and smile, taking out your mouth piece and wrapping it in some paper towel. By now the storm has become background noises as you and the team fill the air with laughter. “Oh my god, that’s perfect!” he laughs and wraps you up in a hug. The power goes out but it’s the least of your worries, you’ve got Clint and Nat right by your side and the rest of the team around you too. The others aren’t too worried, they pull out flashlights and phones to carry on with the game.

Their warmth is nothing compared to the storm raging outside. 

Permanent Tags: @barnes-mendes
